titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: , has begun his work. He may be worth 45/– a week, but he hardly looks so valuable. However time will show. I travelled to Shrewsbury, and presided at a meeting of the Ludlow Archdeaconry Educational Association.

from Leominster attended, and expounded a project for absorbing the Association into the Board of Finance, but to little effect. The matter was postponed for a year. I got back to Hereford by 6.15 p.m.: and went to the Palace, & wrote letters. M
Percival, a friend of Ella's arrived.
